p: Once the percentage of CuFe 2O 4 is obtained from each experiment, it is possible to calculate the values of all of the parameters in eq 1 . The obtained values are b 0 = 86.2, b 1 = 3.3, b 2 = 9.5, and b 12 = âˆ’3.2. Then, we have predicted the purity ( Y) at any point in the area between the tested experimental points. Figure 4 graphically represents the obtained coefficients, as well as the calculated Y values in all of the experimental domain.
